newsitem.title: UK: N.Irish police investigate report of explosion.
newsitem.headline: N.Irish police investigate report of explosion.

text.p: Police in Northern Ireland said on Saturday they were investigating reports of an explosion in County Fermanagh in the west of the British-ruled province.
A spokesman said the blast had apparently occurred outside an unoccupied police station in the village of Tempo. He said no injuries had been reported.

The incident occurred during a period of heightened tension in the province after an upsurge in IRA guerrilla activities and two recent attacks on Catholics which were widely blamed on pro-British loyalist extremists.
The Irish Republican Army abandoned a 17-month ceasefire in February last year with a bombing campaign in English cities which it extended to Northern Ireland in October.
Security has been tightened across the province to counter a growing guerrilla threat which sparked fears of renewed sectarian warfare between Catholic and Protestant militants.
Britain says the IRA must call a truce before its Sinn Fein political wing is allowed into struggling multi-party peace which are due to restart in Belfast on Monday.
